intro: Cattleya bogotensis, commonly known as the Bogotá Cattleya, is a species of orchid native to the Andean region of Colombia. It is characterized by its striking, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or purple with a contrasting lip. The plant has erect, hairy pseudobulbs and long, leathery leaves that help it thrive in its high-altitude habitat. It prefers cool, humid environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its beauty and rarity, it is a prized species among orchid enthusiasts.
